text: My name is Kabir Khan. I'm the Coach of the Indian National Women's Hockey Team..</br>which I have been told are you girls.
Yes sir. Only one's missing..  Uh, Preeti Sabarwal </br>Reporting time was 10 am, wasn't it?
Excuse me! </br>Is this the  registration for the women's team?
The registration for the Indian  National Women's team is over.
Bloody hell! I'm Preeti Sabarwal. </br>Bloody hell Preeti Sabarwal!  You are very late. Try next year.
Everybody, fall in line please!</br>Come on everyone, line up.
She is a good player, sir. </br>I will be the judge of who is a  good player or a bad player Krishnaji. Thank you.
You.. you can't keep out  a state team captain..
Which state team's captain are you?  - Chandigarh </br>Is this the Chandigarh team?
No. But I'm a captain of a state team. </br>And I'm the coach of the  Indian National Women's Team.
I cannot hear or see  the names of states. </br>I can only hear the name  of one country - India.</br>And in that team, there is  no place for late comers. </br> Everyone understand that?
OK..OK, kit up. Kit up and do 10  rounds in exactly 7 minutes. </br>If you are done in 7 minutes,  come join the team. </br>If not, take the  train back to Chandigarh.
Now each player will step  forward and introduce herself. </br>You!
Balbir Kaur, Punjab </br>Break away from the  team and step aside.
Thank you. You are on the team.</br>Anyone else who is playing for Punjab,  Himachal, Tamil Nadu, Railways?

Understand this once and for all,  because I won't repeat it. </br>This team needs only those  players who first play for India, then for their teammates,</br>and then if they have any  life left, for themselves.
Not those who are playing for a  Government job or a Railway flat. Hmmm?
Ho! </br>Ho? Let's try one  more time. Come, please.
